Name: Cornerstone Berkeley
Description: Cornerstone is the East Bay's newest and most exciting Craft Beer Garden and Live Music venue. Our main bar is over 50 ft long and has 42 carefully sourced craft beers and ciders. Our live music venue has a brand new amazing JBL sound and lighting system, a VIP mezzanine and a capacity for over 500 music lovers. Our interior is spacious 13,000 sq ft and has been designed by leading Berkeley architects. We have a large patio with community tables and fire pits. Our reasonably priced menu is based on rustic comfort food (available late March). Our music venue also converts into a game room with ping pong, corn hole and giant janga. Come join us for great beer, great music and good times.

Name: Ivy Room
Description: Long standing neighborhood bar that's been around since the early 1940's. Weekly themed nights include: live music, pub quiz, weekly jam session, funk, rock, indy, psychedelic rock, soul, indy rock, jam, jazz, latin, brass bands, old school dj music, neo soul, cabaret, sporting events, micro beers, specialty cocktails. To perform at the venue, bands must meet several requirements: they need to consistently attract an audience of 100-200 people or collectively reach that number with other acts on the bill. Active and engaging social media activity is crucial, with frequent posts promoting their shows. The band should have a polished and well-honed sound, showcasing the best talent the Bay Area has to offer. Enthusiasm for playing at the venue and a commitment to supporting the local music community are also important. Additionally, bands must ensure they do not have any performances scheduled in the East Bay or San Francisco two weeks before or after their requested date at the Ivy Room.

Name: The Annex Live Music Sessions
Description: The Annex Sessions is a live music series sponsored by the Annex Natural Grocery Store in El Cerrito. We proudly occupy their beautiful space every Wednesday from 6 pm to 8:30 pm. We program music from all over the world and partner with local and Bay Area-wide music professionals to bring quality acts to our community. We are committed to paying musicians fair compensation for their performance, and the Annex has pledged to help us do that with an onging donation that covers some of those needs. Our donors and audience members are an essential part of this support. Half of the proceeds we raise will go directly to our network of local musicians, each of whom have been severely impacted by the lack of events during the COVID-19 pandemic. The other half will be donated to Sound Minds, Oaktown Jazz, and other music education programs our foundation supports.
Address: 10387 San Pablo Ave, El Cerrito, CA 94530

Name: Berkeley Alembic
Description: The Berkeley Alembic is a space for communities of interested humans to meet, grow, synergize, and thrive via meditation, spirituality, movement, dance, art, music, and more. The Berkeley Alembic space also serves as a common ground to foster “gentle bridges” between different groups, cultural sensibilities, and domains of knowledge, including scientific and clinical research, psychotherapy, meditation, spiritual practice, cultural history, and aesthetic exploration. Join us for a class or workshop, in person or online.

Name: East Bay Meditation Center
Description: Located in downtown Oakland, CA, the EBMC offers diversity and social justice-centered contemplative practices. With a strong focus on access and radical inclusion, EBMC provides meditation training and teachings from Buddhism and other wisdom traditions to underrepresented communities. For more than 10 years, EBMC has operated on a gift economics basis, with no set fees or upfront costs. Programs include regular meditation and mindful movement groups, evening classes, and weekend retreats and workshops. Their mission is to foster liberation, personal and interpersonal healing, social action, and inclusivity.

Name: Sound and Soul SF
Description: As a lifelong musician, Emma began exploring sound healing as a way to support her personal practice and foster a greater sense of internal ease, creativity, and embodiment. Having experienced the deeply restorative and supportive effects of vibrational healing, she began to weave these offerings into her public yoga classes, as well as expanding her offerings to private and group sessions around the Bay Area. Emma created Sound and Soul in order to support others in their journey towards greater wholeness, aliveness, and connection to self. She provides a range of sound healing offerings, including private sound baths, private sound journeys, small group sound baths, and corporate/large group sound baths. All offerings are outlined in further detail on the Offerings and Events page.
Attributes: ['Mindfulness', 'Sound baths', 'Sound healing', 'Events', 'Retreat']

Name: 1440 Multiversity
Description: Our 75-acre luxury retreat in the redwoods of Scotts Valley offers cozy accommodations and inspired learning programs for relaxation, renewal and growth. 1440 Multiversity reopened in April 2021 with the intention of creating hope for living well. We are currently accepting private events, gatherings and individual reservations for weekend Rest & Renewal stay packages. Every booking directly supports local advocacy programs such as Healing Our Healthcare Heroes and feeds families in Santa Cruz County through our philanthropic community building efforts.

Name: Venture Retreat Center
Description: Venture Retreat Center is home to personal growth, spiritual and wellness retreats, weddings, and corporate retreats. Nestled among ancient redwoods and meadows, the retreat center is located on a 22-acre site on the Butano Creek in San Mateo County (centrally located about an hour from San Francisco, Palo Alto, and Santa Cruz). We specialize in school, wellness, wedding and corporate retreats and can accomodate any large party! Check out our website on how to book with us for the holiday season!

Name: The Coast Ridge
Description: The Coast Ridge offers 4-day health and wellness excursions unlike any other.  Our days begin with sunrise yoga, followed by 4-5 hours of hiking through incredible landscapes and along trails with expansive coastal views.  After a successful morning on the trail, professional instructors teach a series of exercise classes focused on core and strengthening while restorative yoga ends the day.  Each full day you will eat delicious plant based food geared to keep you going, and get pampered with a massage from an incredible massage therapist. The 4 day reboot is Thursday to Monday, beginning in Stinson Beach. This is a hiking intensive retreat where nature is at the heart of the transformative adventure.
Attributes: ['Mindfulness', 'Health retreat', 'Yoga', 'Hiking', 'Massage', 'Executive retreats', 'Private group retreats']

Name: Cavallo Point Spa
Description: Cavallo Point's Healing Arts Center nurtures and inspires your entire being through spa treatments and experiential learning. Our contemporary Healing Arts Center & Spa features over 11,000 square feet, with 11 treatment rooms for massage and facials, heated outdoor basking pool and peaceful Tea Bar. We welcome both hotel guests and day visitors to the spa. There our highly-trained massage therapists and aestheticians ease you out of daily pressures and into a state of calm and tranquility. Cavallo Point guests can also engage in multi-day experiences focused on fitness and wellness. Our Adventure & Well-Being programs include hiking, mountain biking, meditation, nutrition and more. Let us guide you in healthy living.

Name: Eros Monastery
Description: The Land is a 162-acre practice retreat center located in Mendocino County in Northern California. The Land features redwood forests, trails, a restored meditation barn, a two-acre garden, a hot yoga studio and professionally prepared meals. The property is in the heart of the Anderson Valley bordered by the Navarro river, a 32-minute drive to the Pacific Ocean. The Land is the home of The Eros Monastery, a year-round retreat program whose focus is on helping guests become intimate with themselves and their lives. The Eros Monastery offers a practice-infused daily schedule as well as a monthly calendar of talks, salons, retreats and conferences. The Land also plays hosts to select private events. Personal stays and private event inquiries welcome.
